titleStmt.title: Instructions for Dealing with Inheritances and a Warning against Official Misconduct
titleStmt.author: Kurrah ben Sharik

msContents.summary: A letter from the governor of Egypt, Kurrah b. Sharik, to the pagarch, Basilius, warning against misuse of inheritance by officials and setting out guidelines for dealing with inheritances

msItemStruct.note: inv. 13342a = 11 lines against the fibers, on the back is an acknowledgement of receipt; inv. 13342b = 5 lines against the fibers, the back is blank; little text seems to be missing from between the two fragments
German translation on p. 56-57 of P.Ross.Georg. IV; photograph of inv. 13342a = Tafel 2
For the date, see Recherches de Papyrologie IV (1967), 146 no. 54; the date of the acknowledgement of receipt on the back of inv. 13342a is 9 February, 710 A.D.

provenance.p: Originally in the collection of Zereteli and later added to that of N. Likhachov; now in the Hermitage Museum

div.ab: Fragment I: ...concerning a penalty for local officials in your district who are taking from the bequests of certain wealthy individuals who have died there. And the person who acts in this way, contrary to what we have decreed, is going to be subject to a large punishment on account of his disobedience. Thus, let it not seem like a good idea to you to take a penny from the bequests of such people and to be a detriment to any of the state taxes. And if any member of the pagarch dies, write to me about it, explaining in the very same letter about his property and how much money he managed and about the heirs of his estate. About them, explain to us whether ? is allocating to us . . . may you know that if we discover that someone is taking the slightest. . . . Verso: . . . Mecheir the fifteenth, this was delivered by Saeid, the postal messenger, concerning the bequests. . . .
